results.title: Application of Gestational Blood Glucose Control During Perinatal Period in Parturients with Diabetes Mellitus: Meta-Analysis of Controlled Clinical Studies
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ was more conducive to reducing maternal weight during pregnancy than @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ [MD = -1.55, 95%CI(-2.77,-0.34), Z = -2.5, P = 0.0123], @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ reduced the @<m>DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@abortion@@@ rate compared with @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ [RR = 0.81, 95%CI(0.63,1.05), Z = -2.61, P = 0.015], and reduced cesarean section rate [RR = 0.66, 95%CI(0.49,0.90), Z = -3.95, P = 0.0001].

citations.NLM: Wang T, Zhang W. Application of Gestational Blood Glucose Control During Perinatal Period in Parturients with Diabetes Mellitus: Meta-Analysis of Controlled Clinical Studies Front Surg. 2022;9():893148. PMID: 35910483
citations.BibTeX: @article{35910483, title={Application of Gestational Blood Glucose Control During Perinatal Period in Parturients with Diabetes Mellitus: Meta-Analysis of Controlled Clinical Studies}, author={Wang T and Zhang W}, journal={Front Surg}, volume={9}, pages={893148}}

results.title: Pregnancy outcomes and maternal characteristics in women with pregestational and gestational diabetes: a retrospective study on 206,917 singleton live births.
results.text_hl: .@@@ Risk of prior spontaneous @<m>DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@abortions@@@ was higher in GDM and in pregestational @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2D@@@ (OR: 4.19; 3.30-5.33), mostly treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Gualdani E, Di Cianni G, Seghieri M, Francesconi P, Seghieri G. Pregnancy outcomes and maternal characteristics in women with pregestational and gestational diabetes: a retrospective study on 206,917 singleton live births. Acta Diabetol. 2021 Sep;58(9):1169-1176. PMID: 33835261
citations.BibTeX: @article{33835261, title={Pregnancy outcomes and maternal characteristics in women with pregestational and gestational diabetes: a retrospective study on 206,917 singleton live births.}, author={Gualdani E and Di Cianni G and Seghieri M and Francesconi P and Seghieri G}, journal={Acta Diabetol}, volume={58}, number={9}, pages={1169-1176}}

results.title: Metformin reduces abortion in pregnant women with polycystic ovary syndrome.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ reduces @<m>DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@abortion@@@ in pregnant @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovary syndrome@@@.

citations.NLM: Khattab S, Mohsen IA, Foutouh IA, Ramadan A, Moaz M, Al-Inany H. Metformin reduces abortion in pregnant women with polycystic ovary syndrome. Gynecol Endocrinol. 2006 Dec;22(12):680-4. PMID: 17162710

results.title: Metformin hydrochloride and recurrent miscarriage in a woman with polycystic ovary syndrome.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin hydrochloride@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@recurrent miscarriage@@@ in a @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@polycystic ovary syndrome@@@.

citations.NLM: Palomba S, Falbo A, Orio F Jr, Russo T, Tolino A, Zullo F. Metformin hydrochloride and recurrent miscarriage in a woman with polycystic ovary syndrome. Fertil Steril. 2006 May;85(5):1511.e3-5. PMID: 16647382

results.title: Relationship between abnormal glucose tolerance test and history of previous recurrent miscarriages, and beneficial effect of metformin in these patients: a prospective clinical study.
results.text_hl: The @<m>DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@abortion@@@ rate was significantly reduced after @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ without @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ in comparison to the placebo group (15% vs. 55%).

citations.NLM: Zolghadri J, Tavana Z, Kazerooni T, Soveid M, Taghieh M. Relationship between abnormal glucose tolerance test and history of previous recurrent miscarriages, and beneficial effect of metformin in these patients: a prospective clinical study. Fertil Steril. 2008 Sep;90(3):727-30. PMID: 18001723
citations.BibTeX: @article{18001723, title={Relationship between abnormal glucose tolerance test and history of previous recurrent miscarriages, and beneficial effect of metformin in these patients: a prospective clinical study.}, author={Zolghadri J and Tavana Z and Kazerooni T and Soveid M and Taghieh M}, journal={Fertil Steril}, volume={90}, number={3}, pages={727-30}}

results.title: Metformin-associated lactic acidosis in a pregnant patient.
results.text_hl: We reported a case of @DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@lactic acidosis@@@ in a 28-year-old pregnant @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ (gravida 3, para 0, @<m>DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@abortion@@@ 2, ante-partum 22 weeks) after ingestion of 39.50 g (approximately 80 tablets) @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in a suicide attempt.

citations.NLM: Hong YC, O'Boyle CP, Chen IC, Hsiao CT, Kuan JT. Metformin-associated lactic acidosis in a pregnant patient. Gynecol Obstet Invest. 2008;66(2):138-41. PMID: 18483459
citations.BibTeX: @article{18483459, title={Metformin-associated lactic acidosis in a pregnant patient.}, author={Hong YC and O'Boyle CP and Chen IC and Hsiao CT and Kuan JT}, journal={Gynecol Obstet Invest}, volume={66}, number={2}, pages={138-41}}

results.title: Evidence-based and potential benefits of metformin in the polycystic ovary syndrome: a comprehensive review.
results.text_hl: In particular, we will analyze the uses of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ not only for the treatment of all @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@-related disturbances such as @DISEASE_Dysmenorrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D004412 @@@menstrual disorders@@@, @DISEASE_Infertility @DISEASE_MESH:D007246 @@@anovulatory infertility@@@, increased @<m>DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@abortion@@@, or complicated pregnancy risk, @DISEASE_Hyperandrogenism @DISEASE_MESH:D017588 @@@hyperandrogenism@@@, endometrial, @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Abnormalities @DISEASE_MESH:D018376 @@@metabolic and cardiovascular abnormalities@@@, but also for the prevention of the syndrome.

citations.NLM: Palomba S, Falbo A, Zullo F, Orio F Jr. Evidence-based and potential benefits of metformin in the polycystic ovary syndrome: a comprehensive review. Endocr Rev. 2009 Feb;30(1):1-50. PMID: 19056992
citations.BibTeX: @article{19056992, title={Evidence-based and potential benefits of metformin in the polycystic ovary syndrome: a comprehensive review.}, author={Palomba S and Falbo A and Zullo F and Orio F Jr}, journal={Endocr Rev}, volume={30}, number={1}, pages={1-50}}

results.title: Pregnancy loss, polycystic ovary syndrome, thrombophilia, hypofibrinolysis, enoxaparin, metformin.
results.text_hl: Of the 24 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@, 23 had 65 previous pregnancies without @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Enoxaparin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017984 @@@enoxaparin@@@, with 18 live births, 46 @DISEASE_Abortion_Spontaneous @DISEASE_MESH:D000022 @@@SAB@@@ (71%), and one elective @<m>DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@abortion@@@.

citations.NLM: Glueck CJ, Wang P, Goldenberg N, Sieve L. Pregnancy loss, polycystic ovary syndrome, thrombophilia, hypofibrinolysis, enoxaparin, metformin. Clin Appl Thromb Hemost. 2004 Oct;10(4):323-34. PMID: 15497018
citations.BibTeX: @article{15497018, title={Pregnancy loss, polycystic ovary syndrome, thrombophilia, hypofibrinolysis, enoxaparin, metformin.}, author={Glueck CJ and Wang P and Goldenberg N and Sieve L}, journal={Clin Appl Thromb Hemost}, volume={10}, number={4}, pages={323-34}}

results.title: Metformin in the treatment of clomiphene citrate-resistant women with polycystic ovary syndrome undergoing in vitro fertilisation treatment: a randomised controlled trial.
results.text_hl: Despite the transfer of a similar number of embryos, an insignificant increased in the pregnancy rate along with significant reduction in the @<m>DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@abortion@@@ rate was observed in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@-treated group as compared with the placebo controls.

citations.NLM: Qublan HS, Al-Khaderei S, Abu-Salem AN, Al-Zpoon A, Al-Khateeb M, Al-Ibrahim N, Megdadi M, Al-Ahmad N. Metformin in the treatment of clomiphene citrate-resistant women with polycystic ovary syndrome undergoing in vitro fertilisation treatment: a randomised controlled trial. J Obstet Gynaecol. 2009 Oct;29(7):651-5. PMID: 19757275
citations.BibTeX: @article{19757275, title={Metformin in the treatment of clomiphene citrate-resistant women with polycystic ovary syndrome undergoing in vitro fertilisation treatment: a randomised controlled trial.}, author={Qublan HS and Al-Khaderei S and Abu-Salem AN and Al-Zpoon A and Al-Khateeb M and Al-Ibrahim N and Megdadi M and Al-Ahmad N}, journal={J Obstet Gynaecol}, volume={29}, number={7}, pages={651-5}}

results.title: Continuing metformin throughout pregnancy in women with polycystic ovary syndrome appears to safely reduce first-trimester spontaneous abortion: a pilot study.
results.text_hl: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE(S): Rates of first-trimester @DISEASE_Abortion_Spontaneous @DISEASE_MESH:D000022 @@@spontaneous abortion@@@ and @DISEASE_Isotretinoin_embryopathy_like_syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C535542 @@@teratogenicity@@@. RESULT(S): Before @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, 10 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ had 22 previous pregnancies with 16 first-trimester spontaneous @<m>DISEASE_Abortion_Habitual</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000026 @@@abortions@@@ (73%).

citations.NLM: Glueck CJ, Phillips H, Cameron D, Sieve-Smith L, Wang P. Continuing metformin throughout pregnancy in women with polycystic ovary syndrome appears to safely reduce first-trimester spontaneous abortion: a pilot study. Fertil Steril. 2001 Jan;75(1):46-52. PMID: 11163815
citations.BibTeX: @article{11163815, title={Continuing metformin throughout pregnancy in women with polycystic ovary syndrome appears to safely reduce first-trimester spontaneous abortion: a pilot study.}, author={Glueck CJ and Phillips H and Cameron D and Sieve-Smith L and Wang P}, journal={Fertil Steril}, volume={75}, number={1}, pages={46-52}}
